children.subject: Unless noted otherwise, these courses can fulfill the 20 UD EECS requirement or the 7 units UD Tech elective. this is indicated at the top of the page.
To double check, can these be used as upper-division CS courses or technical electives? In other words, can those be used to for 20 units upper div CS requirement?
See the link. It's up to date.

Does CS 194-26 count as elective for L&S CS major?

Currently enrolled in CS194-26 and was hoping to use it for satisfy elective for the L&S CS major.  However on the CalCentral academic progress report, it says cs194 is not being counted for my electives and is under "Additional Coursework"

194 is on the electives course list on CalCentral and is also an approved course on the EECS page.  

Does CS194-26 count as elective units towards L&S CS major?

Kind of worried because just need 4 elective units to graduate this semester. 

I've read @7525 but still would like a confirmation 

Thanks!

Does this mean that NewMedia190 (Critical Practices) Does not count as a technical elective? I ask because here it says it does count, but also does say "(formerly CS 194-8)" which is the course you're mentioning does not count as major requirement.
I believe that CS282A is currently in the list of approved courses, but my Calcentral still lists it under "Additional Coursework". Does anybody know if this is an error?

history.content:
Please note computer science courses listed on the Berkeley Academic Guide may not be accurate for the list of approved courses for completion of the CS major.  In particular, CS 194-8 and Film 140 are no longer approved CS-UD courses and cannot be used to fulfill the major requirement. 

Please verify approved graduate and special topic courses on the EECS website at https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/special-topics-courses.  This list is the most current and regularly updated.  The Berkeley Academic Guide is only updated once a year during the summer months and may not be current.

If you have any questions or concerns please contact cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu.

Thank you.
